channel.title: Dias Mansion - Price & Practicality Be Damned
channel.description:
Recently I started coming up with ideas for designing a house out of boredom. Since it was something I knew I'd never actually build, so I started making it bigger & adding more & more over-the-top expensive, impractical stuff to it. Sadly I've pretty much run out of junk to add to it asside from currently-impossible technology like teleporters & room-specific gravity control. I was thinking that if I do ever finish designing it I could make it a playable multiplayer map in hammer just for the hell of it. Although it seems I keep starting over from scratch any time I add a lot of things so it might never get done.
Some of the things I might add: * lazy river moat * inset porch behind drawbridge * intercom system * sauna * guest bedrooms * movie theatre * fallout shelter * no library, but a server room * rooftop terrace * balconies * castle-style battlements * helicopter landing pad * hot tubs in the bathrooms * olympic-sized swimming pool outdoor/indoor convertable with a retractable awning & curtian walls * automated double pocket doors with movement prediction * elevators & escalators instead of stairs * waterfall connects from roof to pool or moat * electrochromic smart windows * hydronic radiant underfloor heating * moving walkways
I'd love to hear some more ideas for things to add, althought I'd like to keep the house/castle/mansion/thing somewhat realistic structurally. Fictional things like portals could be added so long as they aren't there solely to access otherwise inaccessable areas.

item.title: Dias Mansion - Price & Practicality Be Damned
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Not everything needs to be gameplay-related.
Heck, I want something that’s a cross between Light Stage 6 & 3D scene reconstruction/animation. There’d be no point to that room in-game, but IRL I’d use it model/animate so much shit with it you’d think it was my fetish.

Read full topic
